title: Temporary Protection visa
summary: This page provides comprehensive information about the Subclass 785 Temporary Protection visa, which allows certain asylum seekers who arrived in Australia without a visa to stay temporarily. It outlines eligibility requirements, conditions, travel restrictions, costs, processing expectations, obligations, and family inclusion rules.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa for people who arrived in Australia without a visa and seek asylum. Allows temporary stay if Australia’s protection obligations are engaged and other requirements are met.
benefits: Stay in Australia temporarily for 3 years
Access government services such as Centrelink, Workforce Australia and Medicare
Access short‑term counselling for torture and trauma
Attend English language classes for free if eligible
Travel overseas (not to home country) with written approval for compassionate or compelling reasons

core_requirements: Must engage Australia’s protection obligations or be a member of the same family unit of a person who does
Meet health, character, identity and security requirements
eligibility.arrival_requirement: Must have arrived in Australia without a valid visa or not been immigration cleared on arrival

application_information.apply_from: Applicants must be in Australia when applying.

requirements: Family members must be in Australia
Family members must be eligible for the visa

members: Spouse or de facto partner of family head
Dependent child or step-child of partner

18_or_over: Incapacitated for work due to loss of bodily or mental functions
Wholly or substantially reliant on parent/step-parent for financial, psychological or physical support
dependent_child_definition.not_dependent_if: Married, engaged, or in a de facto relationship

other_dependent_relative_conditions: Must not have spouse or de facto partner
Wholly or substantially reliant on the family head

newborn_child.automatic_inclusion: Newborn is included in application if born after application submission and before decision.
notification_requirements: Form 1022 Notification of change of circumstances
Clear colour copy of original birth certificate
Attach via ImmiAccount or send certified copy by post
newborn_child.citizenship_note: If a child is born in Australia, they receive the same visa as the parents unless one parent is an Australian citizen or PR, in which case the child may be an Australian citizen by birth.

conditions: Available only if applicant arrived on or after 14 February 2023
Must not be subject to application bars
other_pathways: Certain TPV holders may be eligible for the permanent Resolution of Status (RoS) visa (subclass 851)

notes: Applications are complex and may take time

review_rights.if_refused: Applicants may apply for merits review by the Administrative Review Tribunal (ART).
review_rights.details: Refusal letter will provide information on review rights and timeframes.

travel_conditions.while_application_pending: Leaving Australia before decision causes bridging visa to expire; applicant cannot re-enter unless holding a valid visa.

condition_8570.name: Restricted travel
rules: Cannot travel to home country under any circumstances
May travel to other countries only with written approval on compassionate or compelling grounds
Travelling without approval may result in visa cancellation for applicant and family members

visa_label.information: Visa is digitally linked to travel document or ImmiCard. No physical label is issued.

effects: If holding a bridging visa, withdrawing before decision may prevent future TPV or SHEV applications
Bridging visa expires 35 days after withdrawal
requirements_for_withdrawal: Signatures from all applicants aged 18 or older
